content.description:
AKA:

Eddies High Somewhere

This route was a real score for the first ascent party. Ground up, onsight, all free. It is a fun traditional romp up the center of the

Eddie's High Somewhere

formation.

Pitch 1

: Begin in the center of the wall below a left facing corner/chimney. Climb up the corner treading lightly over the pasted blocks at the bottom. Near the top of the pitch there is a stack on the right that also requires care but can be avoided by holds out left. This pitch is fun and better than it sounds. Belay on a nice ledge at a 2 bolt anchor. 5.8, 80'.

Pitch 2:

Climb a clean splitter hand crack. Belay on a large sloping green ledge at a 2 bolt belay. 5.9, 90'.

Pitch 3

: Move to the right across the ledge and up a wide crack/chimney using TCUs in horizontals for pro. Belay at a 2 bolt anchor near the top of the formation. 5.7, 90'.

Descent

: Rappel the route or walk off.
content.protection:
Single rack to a #3 Camalot. Doubles in the hand sizes may be nice.

60 meter rope.

Helmet.

content.description:
Main Attraction: A large right leaning flake 80' up, it reminds me of something.....

Begin 40’ to the right of the Title Track in a series of broken flakes. Follow flakes up to a bulge, pull through utilizing a short hand/fist crack and onto a ledge (optional gear belay). Climb up finger cracks above the ledge until the large right leaning flake is gained. Pull hard and get established on the flake(crux) and then climb up the wide easy crack above ending on a ledge with a 2 bolt anchor. 5.9+, 120’.

70 Meter Rope Required.
content.protection: Standard Rack to #4 Camalot, double rack of TCU's or equivalent.
content.location: This route is located 40' to the right of the Title Track. Scamper up onto a ledge and locate the giant flake.

climbs.name: Future Artifacts
climbs.fa: Eric Salmi, Dave Littman, Craig Martin, Julia Salmi 2009

content.description:
Start 50' right of The Title Track and scramble up onto a ledge and locate the bolts.

Pitch 1: Climb a slab past 1 bolt up to a ledge. Move right onto a blunt arête and climb past 9 bolts and a couple of cruxes. Belay from a 2 bolt anchor or continue up the next pitch. 5.10a, 100'.

Pitch 2: Follow bolts to the top of the buttress. 5.9, 80'.

Rappel the route or walk off.

This is the right of two bolted routes on the left side of the crag. Fun climbing leads up the left side of an arête. Stick to the arête and look for small, hard to find holds and a tricky sequence. At the top hand traverse to the left for a couple moves and pull up onto a cramped ledge with a 3 bolt anchor and roof above. Shares anchor with Black Mamba 1st pitch.

Gear: a few small to medium cams to supplement the bolts.

Descent: Rappel the route.
content.protection: Bolts and a few smallish cams.

content.description:
Pitch 1: Climb past 10 bolts using high steps and mantles and saving some juice for the final moves. 80', 5.10a/b. 2 bolt anchor.

Pitch 2: Climb over the roof above the belay past 5 bolts and into a thin dihedral crack. Follow this until it becomes a gully grovel and then move left onto the arete and a 2 bolt anchor on a ledge. Great position on this pitch. 80', 5.10a.

Beware of loose rock on the 2nd pitch. For full value climb in 1 pitch.
content.protection: All bolts for the 1st pitch. A few small cams ( #1 TCU - #1 Camalot) for the second pitch to supplement the bolts.
content.location:
Farthest left bolted line on the

Eddie's High Somewhere

formation.
